เกณฑ์ 82,000,000,000,000 ของ Shiba Inu กลับมาอีกครั้ง: SHIB ใกล้ถึงจุดเปลี่ยน

Shiba Inu's 82,000,000,000,000 Threshold Is Back: SHIB on the Verge

1d ago//Arman Shirinyan
general
AI

Summary

TH

Shiba Inu (SHIB) กำลังเผชิญกับแรงกดดันจากการขายอย่างหนักและยังคงดิ้นรนเนื่องจากตลาด cryptocurrency โดยรวมยังคงอ่อนแอ ราคายังไม่สามารถกลับคืนสู่ระดับแนวต้านสำคัญได้ และทุกครั้งที่พยายามฟื้นตัวก็ถูกขัดขวางโดยอุปทานใหม่ที่เข้ามา ปัจจัยหลักที่น่ากังวลคือ exchange reserves กำลังเข้าใกล้เกณฑ์สำคัญที่ 82 ล้านล้าน SHIB ซึ่งในอดีตบ่งชี้ว่านักลงทุนกำลังโอนโทเค็นเข้าสู่ exchange เพื่อเตรียมขาย การสะสมโทเค็นจำนวนมากบน exchange นี้ก่อให้เกิดภาระด้านอุปทาน ทำให้ผู้ถือสามารถระบายขายได้ทันทีแม้ความต้องการจะเพิ่มขึ้นเพียงชั่วคราว ข้อมูลล่าสุดที่แสดง inflow และปริมาณการซื้อขายที่เพิ่มสูงขึ้นบ่งชี้ว่าทั้ง whale และนักลงทุนรายย่อยกำลังวางแผนขายทิ้ง สำหรับการฟื้นตัวที่ยั่งยืนของ SHIB จำเป็นต้องมีการปรับปรุงทางเทคนิคและการลดลงของ exchange reserves เพื่อสะสมโทเค็น มิฉะนั้น แนวโน้มในระยะสั้นยังคงเสี่ยงต่อการร่วงลงอย่างต่อเนื่อง

EN

Shiba Inu (SHIB) is facing significant selling pressure and continues to struggle as the broader cryptocurrency market remains weak. The price action has failed to regain key resistance levels, with every recovery attempt being thwarted by fresh supply. A major concern is the exchange reserve level approaching the critical threshold of 82 trillion SHIB, which historically indicates that investors are moving tokens to exchanges in anticipation of sales. This accumulation of tokens on exchanges creates a substantial supply overhang, allowing sellers to cap rallies easily even if demand temporarily increases. Recent data showing rising inflows and elevated transaction sizes suggests that both large holders and retail participants are positioning for liquidation. For SHIB to see a sustainable recovery, there needs to be a technical improvement on the charts and a significant decline in exchange reserves to signal accumulation; otherwise, the near-term outlook remains dominated by downside risks.

Key Points

  • Shiba Inu (SHIB) is struggling with ongoing selling pressure and failing to break key resistance levels.
  • Exchange reserves are nearing the 82 trillion SHIB threshold, signaling potential incoming sell-offs.
  • A sustainable recovery requires a drop in exchange reserves to show accumulation; otherwise, downside risks persist.

We believe that all content is accurate as of the date of publication, but certain offers mentioned may no longer be available. Due to ongoing selling pressure, Shiba Inu is still struggling as the overall cryptocurrency market is still weak. The long-term downward trend is evident in the price action, which has repeatedly failed to regain important moving averages and resistance levels. Every attempt at recovery has been thwarted by fresh supply , which has caused SHIB to return to its most recent lows. Shiba Inu at key threshold The exchange reserve level, which is getting close to the 82 trillion SHIB threshold , is a critical indicator that is currently receiving attention. Increasing exchange reserves has historically indicated that more tokens are being transferred to exchanges, usually in anticipation of sales. SHIB/USDT Chart by TradingView A substantial supply overhang is developing on the market. When reserves get close to or surpass this range, a structural issue for price recovery is brought about by this circumstance. Large volumes of tokens sitting on exchanges allow sellers to quickly offload positions, capping rallies and igniting new declines even if demand temporarily increases. HOT Stories You Might Also Like The outlook is supported by recent exchange flow data. Both large holders and retail participants may be actively positioning tokens for possible liquidation, as indicated by rising inflows and elevated mean transaction sizes. When combined with SHIB's failure to recover important resistance levels, this suggests that price performance will remain vulnerable. Investors should be cautious about their expectations. Exchange reserves decline A significant decline in exchange reserves that indicates accumulation rather than distribution would be necessary for a sustainable recovery, in addition to a technical improvement on the chart. Rallies will probably continue to be brief until that change takes place. In the event that selling pressure persists and reserves firmly surpass 82 trillion, SHIB may experience another decline as supply surpasses demand. As of right now, market conditions point to attempts at stabilization rather than a confirmed reversal, which means that the near-term outlook is still dominated by downside risk.
